1 Settings

The settings section includes a series of variables to configure our project. You could find two differente types of variables; the default ones which should be modified v√≠a theming and the immutable ones which are internally used by the framework and shouldn't be modified.

Variables

var default value desc
$egeo-namespace
 !default 'st-'
A prefix included in all classes created by the UI Kit.
$egeo-nobem-namespace
 !default 'st-nobem-'
A prefix included in all classes created by the UI Kit to be used in projects which are not using BEM like naming methodology.
$egeo-fontface-src
 !default 'assets/fonts'
A base url from which the @font-face directive will seek the font folders.

Why a UI Kit namespace?

The use of a namespace that prefix all classes exposed ensures that the classes of the framework will have no collisions with the classes defined in the project the framework will be imported on.

Why a non-BEM namespace?

When you are building a project using BEM Methodology, created by Yandex, you are building a CSS with flat specificity due to almost all selectors used are delimited to one class, that is equal to 10 points of specificity. That means that if you load the files of the framework in the right order, the classes always be respond as expected, overwritten the styles necessary, for example, when you are using utils.

However, if you are not working with BEM or you are using external libraries not built with BEM like Bootstrap, AngularUI or Foundation, then you have to overwritte some styles using !important flag due to you have no way to know what specifity could have a selector. Even knowing it, you would have to create a selector specifically written for each selector you want to overwrite. A mess.

For that, some classes and placeholders in the framework uses the non-BEM namespace to ensure that the !important flag is used and they can overwrite any class in the project.

1.1 settings.colors

In this file are defined the variables related to the use of colors. By default, the colors included in the main Sass map $colors are the ones defined by the Design Team in the visual specification.

Variables

var default desc
$colors
 !default
The default Sass map of colors. By default, the map includes the whole colors of the visual specification.

Sass Map $colors

c1: #37b5e4
c1b: #2d96bd
c2: #b7bfc3
c2b: #92989c
c3: #485566
c3b: #2d3540
c4: #222b37
c5: #d3d8db
g0: #fff
g1: #fbfbfb
g2: #f3f3f3
g3: #e4e4e4
g4: #cbcbcb
g5: #b5b5b5
g6: #999
g7: #777
g8: #555
g9: #242424
g10: #000
f1: #222b37
f2: #1a212b
f3: #eff2f3
f4: #e1e4e5
f5: #fff
e1: #93ae65
e1b: #7d9456
e1c: #9fad87
e2: #eb8817
e2b: #d17915
e2c: #eb9e46
e3: #d24234
e3b: #b8392e
e3c: #d15549
a1: #d0c120
a2: #21d8de
a3: #bcea3

1.2 settings.typography

In this file are defined the variables related to the use of typography.

Variables

var default desc
$font-families
 !default
The default Sass map of font families declared in the visual specifications.
$font-weights
 !default
The default Sass map of font weights declared in the visual specifications.
$font-sizes
 !default
The default Sass map of font sizes declared in the visual specifications.
$line-heights
 !default
The default Sass map of line heights declared in the visual specifications.

Sass map $font-families

Result Value Key
Brandon Grotesque Brandon Grotesque brandon-grotesque
Open Sans Open Sans open-sans

Sass map $font-sizes

Result Value Key
Open Sans 4rem xgiant
Open Sans 3rem giant
Open Sans 2.5rem xxxlarge
Open Sans 2rem xxlarge
Open Sans 1.5rem xlarge
Open Sans 1.2rem large
Open Sans 1rem medium
Open Sans .8rem small
Open Sans .7rem xsmall
Open Sans .6rem xxsmall
Open Sans .5rem xxxsmall

Sass map $font-weights

Result Value Key
Open Sans 900 bolder
Open Sans 700 bold
Open Sans 500 semibold
Open Sans 400 normal
Open Sans 200 light

Sass map $line-heights

double

1.3 settings.icons

This file only include an import of the Stratio Icon Font. You can see the detail of the whole icons imported in the visual reference.

To use any icon, you only need to create a tag with the class of the icon. All classes are defined in the visual reference.

Markup

<i class="icon-datetime"></i>

Compatibility

The Stratio Icon Font is provided in EOT, SVG, TTF and WOFF formats so it is compatible with all modern browsers and the most of the older ones. You can see a compatibility table of this formats in the fonts section.

1.4 settings.fonts

This file only include an import of the Fonts specified in the visual reference. You can see below the families and formats imported as well as a reference compatibility table.

Fonts

Font Families Formats available
Brandon Grotesque
Light, Regular, Bold, Black
 EOT, SVG, TTF, WOFF
Open Sans
Light, LightItalic, Regular, Italic, Semibold, SemiboldItalic, Bold, BoldItalic, ExtraBold, ExtraBoldItalic
 EOT, SVG, TTF, WOFF

Compatibility

Font format IE Chrome Firefox Safari Opera Edge
TTF/OTF 9.0+* 4.0+ 3.5+ 3.1+ 10.0+ 12+
WOFF 9.0+ 5.0+ 3.6+ 5.1+ 11.1+ 12+
WOFF2 Not supported 36.0+ 35.0* Not supported 26.0+ 12+
SVG Not supported 4.0+ Not supported 3.2+ 9.0+ 12+
EOT 6.0+ Not supported Not supported Not supported Not supported 12+
  • IE: The font format only works when set to be "installable".
  • Firefox: Disabled by default, but can be enabled (need to set a flag to "true" to use WOFF2).

Compatible in IE8+, Edge 12+, Firefox 3.5+, Chrome 4+, Safari 3.1+, Opera 9+

Dependencies

  • tools.log: The fonts uses the logger tool to show debug info.
Created using kss-node and kss-node-template.
